 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;

    text-decoration: none;

    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      text-align: left;

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Sorry I wasn't clearer: Your trigger button does not close the window, because it's being blocked from doing so due to existing security policies (specifically, the attempt to close the window is blocked by this line: <span class="line"><!---->Sorry I wasn't clearer: Your trigger button does not close the window, because it's being blocked from doing so due to existing security policies (specifically, the attempt to close the window is blocked by this line: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc;l=347;drc=e1facbdd9b6cfe6f5ec53f8b20e662c934e75045<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc;l=347;drc=e1facbdd9b6cfe6f5ec53f8b20e662c934e75045"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc;l=347;drc=e1facbdd9b6cfe6f5ec53f8b20e662c934e75045<!----></a> )<span class="line"><!----> )<!----></span><br><br>I wanted to make sure you're not running with any custom command-line flags or options here that would be useful to verify the repro.<span class="line"><!---->I wanted to make sure you're not running with any custom command-line flags or options here that would be useful to verify the repro.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Note: window.close() requires that your tab has no history to close the window (won't work unless you have a fresh browsing session.)<span class="line"><!---->Note: window.close() requires that your tab has no history to close the window (won't work unless you have a fresh browsing session.)<!----></span><br><br>Please chrome as:<span class="line"><!---->Please chrome as:<!----></span><br><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "about:blank" "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "about:blank" "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span> "about:blank"<span class="line"><!----> "about:blank"<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        This bug requires manual review: We are only 12 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 12 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), geohsu@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), geohsu@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yes, please merge to M89, branch 4389.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, please merge to M89, branch 4389.<!----></span><br><br>There's unlikely to be another M88 release but I'll keep the Merge-Request-88 label until we're certain.<span class="line"><!---->There's unlikely to be another M88 release but I'll keep the Merge-Request-88 label until we're certain.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>

          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;

          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;

          width: 100%;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

          min-width: 256px;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

          <aside class="metadata-container">
            <mr-issue-metadata></mr-issue-metadata>

        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;

        }

          margin-bottom: 0.75em;

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)

 else

 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;

    .__crdxFeedbackButton {
      background-image: url('https://storage.cloud.google.com/chops-feedback/icon.png');

      transform: translateX(-50%);
      transition: opacity .4s;
      -webkit-transform: translateX(-50%);
    }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

        }

          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;

          text-align: center;

                  <!---->:

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

          Note:<b>Note:</b>

      VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 90.0.4399.0 (Official Build) canary (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 90.0.4399.0 (Official Build) canary (x86_64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: MacOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: MacOS<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Similar to <span class="line"><!---->Similar to <!----></span>issue 1138911<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138911" title="Security: UAF in TabStrip"><!---->issue 1138911<!----></a><br><br>1. Run chrome with "about:blank" "<span class="line"><!---->1. In the second tab click on the button then to drag the third tab "about:blank" out of the current tab strip slowly >> crash<span class="line"><!---->2.         Sorry I wasn't clearer: Your trigger button does not close the window, because it's being blocked from doing so due to existing security policies (specifically, the attempt to close the window is blocked by this line: <span class="line"><!---->Sorry I wasn't clearer: Your trigger button does not close the window, because it's being blocked from doing so due to existing security policies (specifically, the attempt to close the window is blocked by this line: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc;l=347;drc=e1facbdd9b6cfe6f5ec53f8b20e662c934e75045<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc;l=347;drc=e1facbdd9b6cfe6f5ec53f8b20e662c934e75045"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc;l=347;drc=e1facbdd9b6cfe6f5ec53f8b20e662c934e75045<!----></a> )<span class="line"><!----> )<!----></span><br><br>I wanted to make sure you're not running with any custom command-line flags or options here that would be useful to verify the repro.<span class="line"><!---->I wanted to make sure you're not running with any custom command-line flags or options here that would be useful to verify the repro.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Note: window.close() requires that your tab has no history to close the window (won't work unless you have a fresh browsing session.)<span class="line"><!---->Note: window.close() requires that your tab has no history to close the window (won't work unless you have a fresh browsing session.)<!----></span><br><br>Please chrome as:<span class="line"><!---->Please chrome as:<!----></span><br><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "about:blank" "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "about:blank" "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span> "about:blank"<span class="line"><!----> "about:blank"<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;

      </style>
      
      
    <mr-launch-overview class="main-item" hidden=""><!---->
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;

        }

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

          width: 100%;

        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);

    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    display: block;

  }

  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);

    display: grid;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      text-align: left;
    }

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Sorry I wasn't clearer: Your trigger button does not close the window, because it's being blocked from doing so due to existing security policies (specifically, the attempt to close the window is blocked by this line: <span class="line"><!---->Sorry I wasn't clearer: Your trigger button does not close the window, because it's being blocked from doing so due to existing security policies (specifically, the attempt to close the window is blocked by this line: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc;l=347;drc=e1facbdd9b6cfe6f5ec53f8b20e662c934e75045<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc;l=347;drc=e1facbdd9b6cfe6f5ec53f8b20e662c934e75045"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc;l=347;drc=e1facbdd9b6cfe6f5ec53f8b20e662c934e75045<!----></a> )<span class="line"><!----> )<!----></span><br><br>I wanted to make sure you're not running with any custom command-line flags or options here that would be useful to verify the repro.<span class="line"><!---->I wanted to make sure you're not running with any custom command-line flags or options here that would be useful to verify the repro.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Note: window.close() requires that your tab has no history to close the window (won't work unless you have a fresh browsing session.)<span class="line"><!---->Note: window.close() requires that your tab has no history to close the window (won't work unless you have a fresh browsing session.)<!----></span><br><br>Please chrome as:<span class="line"><!---->Please chrome as:<!----></span><br><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "about:blank" "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "about:blank" "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span> "about:blank"<span class="line"><!----> "about:blank"<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1.
